summary: This bill, the NIH Reform Act, proposes to split the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) into three separate national research institutes: the National Institute of Allergic Diseases, the National Institute of Infectious Diseases, and the National Institute of Immunologic Diseases. It amends the Public Health Service Act to reflect these changes, including the appointment of new directors, clarifies the duties of each institute, and addresses the transition of authorities and resources. Relevant sections of the act are updated, and conforming amendments are made to other related sections.
